tags: WTF is going on in Game of Thrones?
summary: All My Thrones
title: All My Thrones
body:
Hey, all, I was cleaning out my draft folder of doom, and found this review of Game of Thrones from er 2014 (?) that I possibly didn’t publish, since I can’t find it anywhere.   Since people are all into the last season and all that, I figured I’d throw it up here so they can be reminded that it’s been insane since the beginning.  Also, it’s a post!  Check out up top for like a few other…

View On WordPress

blog.name: dumpling-things

blog.description: Sharing what I like, because it would too bad to be the only one seeing it on my dash.

tags: I'm so pissed off the more I think about this last episode hahahahahha
I have a lot of post that explains much better what's wrong
that I'm planning to reblog now
summary: I have so many things to say about GoT S08E05
title: I have so many things to say about GoT S08E05
body:
• I’m like, going to talk about the major deaths that happened in this episode, and the main characters who unfortunately survived this mess
  • Varys
    • let’s be real, the fact that he was still alive in this season is already a miracle in itself
    • that said, I’m disappointed that Daenerys didn’t give him a proper trial like she would have if her character wasn’t inexistent in this season (but more on that later!)
  • Sandor
    • I did find fitting that he died while battling his bro
    • like he said, getting revenge was his entire life, and I honestly can’t imagine him having a life after his brother’s death
    • but also that was a bad death
    • not only speaking about him going down in fire, aka his trauma, because I’m a dumb turtle and my reflexion isn’t going that far, it’s only because I read some posts
    • no, because I wish we could have seen him victorious
    • I was ready to see him die, but after we saw his brother dead
    • a final victory, and Sandor letting go
  • Euron Greyjoy
    • so like
    • we didn’t get the satisfaction of seeing Yara fucking kill him???
    • disappointing
  • Cersei
    • am I supposed to feel bad for her??????
    • what was the point???????????????????????
    • SHE DIED CRUSHED BY THE RED KEEP?????????????????
    • this is so unsatisfying????????????
    • again, am I supposed to feel bad for her??????????? when she was the most villainous out of all of them, and you expect me to forget that by showing her crying that she doesn’t want her baby to die????????????????
    • CRUSHED BY BRICKS FFS
    • rip the goddamn Valonqar prophecy too
  • Jaime
    • honestly, I could understand him going back to Cersei because that’s his character, he’s loyal to a fault
    • BUT
    • he did have character development???
    • the only reason I could fully understand his decision to come back was him going back to give Cersei the death she deserves himself, as a final act of someone who loved her dearly enough to not want to see her going further down in a mad path
    • AND WE ONLY HAVE THEM DYING CRUSHED BY BRICKS WHILE HUGGING?????
    • rip Jaime’s character development
  • Daenerys
    • rip
    • seriously
    • rest in pieces
    • you were a very good character, and you were dying this season but now you officially died
    • I’m honestly so sad about how she’s written, you have no idea
    • frankly speaking, the only likeness of “madness” we got from her were only directed to her enemies during the previous seasons
    • and now you try to sell me her going on a fire rampage against INNOCENTS
    • when she spent the past season DEFENDING INNOCENTS
    • it honestly make no sense
    • I’m hating this Mad Queen storyline because it’s so fucking badly written
    • it’s only coming off as a “women are too emotional to rule, hence why we need a male ruler”
    • the timing is so off
    • like she became mad just when we learned about Jon having more rights to the throne
    • it’s honestly just a retelling of the woman dying to propel the male hero
    • because let’s face it, Dany is probably going to get killed in the next episode
  • Jon
    • stop telling he would make a good ruler
    • this guy is a fucking wallflower since he came back from the dead
    • not once in his life he made a good decision as a ruler
    • “you would rule kindly” and that is the whole problem!!
    • Jon is too fucking kind and softhearted to make a good ruler, he’s not ready to make sacrifices
    • the fact that he’s all set up to inherit the fucking throne when Dany did all the job to take it back makes me puke blood
  • Arya
    • gdi let her catch a break
    • I’m disappointed we’re not seeing more of her training as an assassin
    • don’t get me wrong, I love the fact that we see her panicking and such
    • she’s still a child after all
    • but still
    • what was the point of all her character development so far??
    • apart from killing the Night King (which I also find it to be a bit of a… bad writing choice, even if it was fucking cool) she’s doing nothing but running around to escape

That’s it for me

I never intended to see this season as the true ending that will be in the books
But now I’m not even going to consider this as the ending of the show

For me, this season of GoT is just fanfiction written by a cishet white male who needs to pump his ego by destroying characters except his self insert Jon Snow

tags: i agree jamies arc is garbage
summary:
Dany burning down that city was great. 
It made sense for her character, she heard those bells and what was she supposed to do?...
body:
Unpopular Opinion

Dany burning down that city was great.

It made sense for her character, she heard those bells and what was she supposed to do? Trust Tyrion lay down her weapons and just walk in? For all she knows Cersei could have laid a trap.


You can see the emotions twisting in her face when the bells are ringing before she sets off, she’s not gone mad, she’s taking what’s hers the only way she knows it will work. Fire and blood.


Think about it, she’s tried the slow way before, she’s tried reasoning with Cersei and she lost 2 dragons because of her, she’s not gonna risk loosing again.


It made perfect sense and it was a devestating moment in the series, it was so hard to watch, but just because you don’t like something doesn’t mean it’s bad writing.


Dany burning the city made sense, stop whining about it.

summary: 'Game of Thrones' Season 8, Episode 5 Recap: Boom, Roasted.
title: 'Game of Thrones' Season 8, Episode 5 Recap: Boom, Roasted.
body:
‘Game of Thrones’ Season 8, Episode 5 Recap: Boom, Roasted. Let’s stop pretending Dany doesn’t have reason to burn it all. #GameofThrones

Image: HBO Is Daenerys the “Mad” Queen or just plain angry?

This episode is supposed to be the one that establishes Dany as the “Mad Queen”. 5 minutes in, we know that Daenerys has put herself in seclusion following the deaths of her dragon Rhaegal and best friend, Missandei. She’s reached her breaking point.

What has become painfully obvious from the last two seasons, is that the…

View On WordPress

summary:
the pale horse thing doesnt make much sense to me because the book of revelation
 has a white horse and a pale horse. the pale...
body: the pale horse thing doesnt make much sense to me because the book of revelation has a white horse and a pale horse. the pale horse is not white. the pale horse is more a discolored sickly off-green/yellowed horse the color of decaying flesh. the white horse is the one ridden by “Conquest”/“pestilence”.

reblog.comment: the pale horse thing doesnt make much sense to me because the book of revelation has a white horse and a pale horse. the pale horse is not white. the pale horse is more a discolored sickly off-green/yellowed horse the color of decaying flesh. the white horse is the one ridden by “Conquest”/“pestilence”.

blog.name: fema1erebel
blog.title: female rebel
blog.description: She cares too much, that's why she's standing aside.

summary: She shouldn’t have trusted anyone. I’m just saying if Dany would have played by Sansa’s rule “You’re not one of us”. If she...
body:
She shouldn’t have trusted anyone.

I’m just saying if Dany would have played by Sansa’s rule “You’re not one of us”. If she wouldn’t try to save Jon, then to save north, to make them accept her. She didn’t gain ANYTHING from this, and she lost almost EVERYTHING. Varys tried to poison her, her own advisor, what she was supposed to do? Pat him on the back? And even now going full Targ she still trusts Jon and well….

I’m not saying she’s innocent, but people are faulty and are the product of stuff happening to them. D&D even stated if not for these circumstances she wouldn’t have burn the KL. 💁🏻‍♀️

There’s a saying “Don’t do good - won’t endure evil”. Which is a very toxic message to be send. And I’m really quite done with toxic messages of got.

I’m not saying she’s innocent, but people are faulty and are the product of stuff happening to them. D&D even stated if not for these circumstances she wouldn’t have burn the KL. 💁🏻‍♀️

summary: "Game of Thrones" Casting Director is Now Casting Photo Doubles for a New Project
title: "Game of Thrones" Casting Director is Now Casting Photo Doubles for a New Project
body:
“Game of Thrones” Casting Director is Now Casting Photo Doubles for a New Project

“Game of Thrones” extras casting director is now casting for an undisclosed production in Northern Ireland.

Casting directors are now casting actors, models, and talent to work on scenes filming in Northern Ireland.

Producers are seeking the following types:

  • FEMALE CAST DOUBLE who is ideally under 5ft tall. They will be regularly on camera so need to listen well and be able to take direction.

Car…

blog.name: aristocratic-principle
blog.title: Hussein W. Qattan
blog.description: A lion doesn’t concern himself with the opinions of the sheep.

tags: A song of ice and fire
summary: “Fools look at the Westerlands and see gold. Fools see our wealth and call it strength. Gold is just another rock. The...
body:
“Fools look at the Westerlands and see gold. Fools see our wealth and call it strength. Gold is just another rock. The Westerlands are strong because of House Lannister. From strong leadership comes unity. From unity comes power”.


-Lord Tywin Lannester

reblog.comment:
“Fools look at the Westerlands and see gold. Fools see our wealth and call it strength. Gold is just another rock. The Westerlands are strong because of House Lannister. From strong leadership comes unity. From unity comes power”.

-Lord Tywin Lannester

-Lord Tywin Lannester

summary: Hơn 3.500 cặp cha mẹ phải hối hận vô cùng sau khi tập 5 Game of Thrones mùa cuối lên sóng
title: Hơn 3.500 cặp cha mẹ phải hối hận vô cùng sau khi tập 5 Game of Thrones mùa cuối lên sóng
body:
Hơn 3.500 cặp cha mẹ phải hối hận vô cùng sau khi tập 5 Game of Thrones mùa cuối lên sóng

*Cảnh báo Spoiler: Bài viết có tiết lộ nội dung phim

Với các fan của siêu phẩm phim truyền hình Game of Thrones, thì tập mới nhất trong mùa cuối cùng vừa lên sóng là cả một nỗi thất vọng. Cú twist của bộ dôi biên kịch D&D (David Benioff và D. B. Weiss) đã phá sập những gì chính họ đã xây dựng trong gần một thập kỷ vừa qua, và cũng giết chết luôn đứa con tinh thần của George R.R. Martin.

Trong thế…

View On WordPress
